title: On the conditions of Galio's rework...
body:
(Quoted from the ticket I had sent to Riot) 
As a Galio main for several years in League, Galio's revamp has caused a great deal of distress to me and several others that I have seen.  "Revamp" or not, it appears that no trace of the old Galio remains besides the taunt from his ult and durand's name on one skill from the looks of it (and if that's really a "Trace", then I guess all taunting tanks are part Galio.). While a lot of players that never played galio are happy about it, I would like to send a request regarding the conditions of this revamp, as it doesn't appear to sufficiently stay faithful to the original concept....at all. 

This is, quite literally, a new champ.  The reason why the negative feedback in necessarily high about this is that, regardless of whatever's going on to those that did play Galio, people are seeing a new champ and are simply pleased by that. I'm speaking on account of those of us that had mained the original Galio for several years though. As quoted by the riot staff in his Q&A on redit, they stated they did this revamp like so because, "Very very few people" in League were pleased by his winrate. Please note that from my observations, Galio was never given a chance to become stronger, and with item changes (Most notably things like changing {{item:3174}} ), he only got passively weaker. This goes to show that their data is most likely inaccurate and doesn't work correctly to display the true feelings of those that played Galio. Likewise, "Very Very Few", is still a lot of people when taking account the number of those that play League. There's hundreds of thousands, maybe millions of league players, so even .01% of the population being unhappy about the revamp would still be at least ten thousand individuals. 

While I do understand that as a company, Riot must take steps to ensure optimal profit, the original Galio was in no way hindering the game. His design and such, has been altered enough by this rework that the original Galio doesn't in fact, currently exist now. I would like to request that either the rework be rolled back, or the two Galios be separated. The two champions are far too different for this rework to do justice for him. 

I would also like to present proof of the discontent of those that mained Galio, simply by providing the link yo the Galio subreddit, and to a few screenshots I made of players in the reddit responding to this revamp. 

Thank you for reading this ticket fully, and I beg that your company take into consideration the feelings of those that played this champ for so many years before that of those that never played him, and perhaps try to take steps to make a considerable compromise. Many of us that saw the revamp are leaving League, I myself included. If this isn't resolved, there isn't a way to fix it. Many of us are feeling bitter about the removal of our main champion and would like to have the benefit of Riot understanding and attempting to fix this. 

So, what do you guys think of this? Maybe if this gets popular enough, Riot staff will actually give us a couple cents of attention...

You have champion updates, and reworks, and I was hoping his would be more inline with Fiora, Warwick and Taric, where you feel like it's clearly the same champion, but updated for the current time. 

Sion, Poppy and Taric had clear design flaws that made it so if they were ever too viable, they were just broken. (point and click stun, immunity,etc.) So big changes were warranted.

Galio was actually in a decent spot with a high win rate, good at what he did. Galio was a disengage/peel tank, similar to the likes of Cho'gath or Braum, awful at engaging w/o flash but his Q made him a great peeler, along with shielding carries and his ultimate to round up divers. 

Now he's just an all around tank, that happens to be good against AP. What always bothered me about Galio was that even though he was good against magic he never really screwed magic damage users over in the same fashion that Malphite or Rammus did to AD users. 

If you picked Malphite or Rammus into a full AD team it was pretty much GG, not just because there damage scaled with Armor, but they're kits inheritly screw over AD users. Malphite with his attack speed slow, helping his **entire team** and Rammus reflecting damage back. 

I was hoping the Galio rework would make him the AP Malphite, but all he got as a Magic shield. Imo if they just gave old Galio the current passive he has now and just take the absurd cast time away on his E, he would have been fine. 

Regardless I'm liking the new Galio and I think he'll be a fine addition to my champion pool. His Q is still there even if it doesn't slow, and I don't have to worry about getting CC'd for my taunt. I mean the amount of CC he has is kind of crazy.
Yeah, he's pretty nice as a standalone champ. I just wish I could still play as the gargoyle I loved and came to league for.
If it helps, I'm sorry for your loss.

He was ment to be tanky, especiallly vs magic damage, that's not the same as beeing a tank.
The closest 'class' that discribed him would be battle mage, tanky with decent damage but not to much cc/mobillity.
Gallio fit very well into that profile, just that his huge aoe cc ult somewhat pushed him towards tank a bit more.

It's also noteable that Gallios most succesfull builts through out his entier existence(that recently came to an end) were rather ap-heavy, so claiming that he was more a mage than a tank is totally valid.
He spend more time in distance to his opponents, useing the range of his base kit, and only closed in when his W was up and for the ult.
Just like swain or vlad, his tank tools didn't make him a huge frontline, but more allowed him to aim for the opposing back line without fearing the opposing front line while beeing hard to kill without focused fire when his W was down or healreduce.
And yet he was stuck with melee auto attacks.

Yea, and that's the main flaw of old galio and not much else. His melee AAs felt of cause he wasn't really rewarded for going melee asides from the ult(that also had ~550 range if you just wanted a specific target)
He didn't even have good base stats on his AAs unlike other tanks like malph, mao or gragas. It was more in line with mages like morgana.
So imo there were two good ways to solve that issue: give him a reward in meleerange, and simply changeing his passive the way they did would have been enough(with some number balanceing for his overall damage), giving him a reason to use go in meleerange duering his W tankiness window for the extra burst.
Or Giving him ranged AAs, imo 450 range like morgana would have gone a long way for him, still keeping him somewhat close combat as tanky mage, but not full melee without payoff either.
But that rework, besides deleteing his form character in terms of story, art and vo, eliminated nearly all mage aspects and turned him into a clear tank. And Galio never was a pure tank, he always was a mage/tank hybrid.
Also, his melee attacks are actually a point for him beeing a mage: Every tank has a kit that works better if they can stay close to their opponents, either aoe dots like Amumu's W, spamable close combat spells or echanted AAs, spells that automatically get you to melee range and so on. 
Thx to his pointless AAs and no other melee skills, Galio never profited from going melee later on(in lane, especially vs mages, the AAs still had impact). In teamfights, Galio would have the same effective impact with his base kit from ~800 range as he would have in melee range, which fits for a mage but is very unusal for a tank.

First off, no need to flip out like that. 

Second, he was a melee mage. Why?

He wasn't actually a melee mage either....he mainly focused on skillshots. He was an ap heavy champ with a focus on a passive that gave him more AP for his MR. Bulwark wasn't even a melee aspect, as  the shield was for _others,_ not himself. (while it could be applied to him it would heal him less and less.)

But they could have at least given him ranged abilities. Wouldn't have fixed all his problems, it still wasn't great that it was basically use your abilites. Wait for your abilities to come off cooldown.

He did have ranged abilities though, and for the damage they dealt (Which was, rather significant, especially provided that they debuffed opponents as well) the range and cooldown was pretty logical. If they just fixed that, it would've been much better...I'm really just depressed that the revamp turned Galio into something really different from his original concept. Perhaps they should've moved more toward a support, which, provided your argument for the whole guardian aspect, would've still been a lot more suitable. Wouldn't you agree?

Oh, whoops, I meant ranged basic attacks.

Honestly, he can still support, but I just prefer him now. He just looked ugly in his old version, at least to me. He also didn't fit demacia visually, and his gameplay was weird and didn't super fit. Why were all his abilities ranged when hi ult was melee?

Ranged basic attacks would've honestly fitted old Galio really well, provided his setup, but it's not like Riot tried to adjust old Galio before the recreation. 

Gargoyles are meant to look intimidating, as their original design besides being a waterspout was to ward off evil spirits from a building. His original intention wasn't for demacia, but to protect Durand, his creator as well, so the lack of a 100% demacian look made sense. Now, the melee ult was pretty peculiar, but as I mentioned earlier, it was built for optimal use in a team fight. His kit made it more than possible to get within melee range of players via his E. 

The new design honestly urks me because I really like monstrous champs, and we've already 20+ other generic muscular men, so they could've at least let us keep a single gargoyle or monster that wasn't either a god, mythical creature, or a voidspawn.

I just feel like they did a good job, gave his kit more cohesion, and finally gave him some CC.

I get that you don't like him, but some other people will, and it's not the end of the world.

Yeah, but here's the question. Was this rework worth removing a champ several people mained, just for a couple people to play him sparingly, but overall most likely never touch him? They didnt simply give his kit more cohesion, they gave him an entirely new kit. And he had some okay CC already, provided you built low cooldown and high mp regen alongside MR. (which was rather simple.) 

They should've just made the revamp a new champ. Sure, people will like new Galio, but as I've seen, the people that already played Galio don't, and that's really what should matter. 10 games from someone that'll play him rarely vs. 1,000+ from a main, and you kinda see why it'd be such a terrible change for mains.

But if they'd just made him a new champ, they would have had people accusing htem of ripping off galio's plot. Or they would have to make something weirder. He fits his new theme pretty well, IMO.

Also, give him some time. Maybe you'll grwo to like him.

Nah. I don't like Demacia in all honesty, and if I dont like Garen, I sure as hell wont like his new copycat.

Old galio's plot was that he was trying to compensate for his creator's death when he failed to defend him from some assassins. He was always awake the entire time, observing the entire world for what could be seen as a long time under the guise of a lifeless gargoyle. Then poppy came along and reminded him of what Durand fought for. 

Basically, compared to new Galio that literally just wakes up to fight because that's his purpose of creation, Galio's entire gist was he was fighting for retribution because he lost his original purpose as durand's guardian.

Also, old and new Galio are opposites in personality. New Galio is basically, "Galio smash!" whereas old Galio was compensating for something, quite literally.
